titles.title: To establish a formula for the calculation of livestock grazing fees for the use of National Forest System lands in the 16 contiguous Western States and public domain lands administered by the Bureau of Land Management.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Executive Comment Requested from USDA, Interior.

bill.summary: 6/6/1997--Introduced. Amends the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 to direct: (1) the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a fair market value grazing fee with respect to National Forest System lands in the 16 contiguous Western States (except National Grasslands) administered by the Forest Service; and (2) the Secretary of the Interior to establish similar fees with respect to public domain lands administered by the Bureau of Land Management. Makes such fees effective as of March 1, 1998. Sets forth the formula for calculating fair market value. Abolishes certain grazing advisory boards.
